title: Convert amounts into first equation
text: Let's use "q" as the number of quarters and "n" as the number of nickels. Because the number of nickels is $$6$$ less than $$3$$ times the number of quarters, we can identify the first equation to be $$n=3q-6$$.
speech: Let's use "q" as the number of quarters and "n" as the number of nickels. Because the number of nickels is  6  less than  3  times the number of quarters, we can identify the first equation to be  n is equal to, 3 q minus 6 .

title: Convert amoutn into second equation
text: Because the total amount of money is $$\$7.30$$ and quarters are $$\$0.25$$ and nickels are $$\$0.05$$ we can determine that the second equation is $$0.25q+0.05n=7.3$$
speech: Because the total amount of money is  dollars 7.30,  and quarters are  dollars 0.25,  and nickels are  dollars 0.05,  we can determine that the second equation is  0.25 q plus 0.05 n is equal to 7.3

title: Plug in
text: We can plug in $$n=3q-6$$ using the second equation to get $$0.25q+\operatorname{0.05}\left(3q-6\right)=7.3$$
speech: We can plug in  n is equal to 3 q minus, 6  using the second equation to get  0.25 q, plus 0.05 of, parentheses, 3 q minus 6,  is equal to 7.3

using the second equation to get   0.25 q, plus 0.05 of, , 3 q minus 6,  is equal to 7.3

title: Solve for a
text: We can determine that the second equation simplified would be $$0.4q-0.3=7.3$$. We now isolate the variable "q" and get $$0.4q=7.6$$. Then, we can divide both sides by $$0.4$$ to get $$q=19$$. There are $$19$$ quarters.

title: Solve for c
text: After solving for "q", we can plug that value into the first equation to get $$n=3(19)-6$$ which we can determine $$n$$ to be $$51$$.
speech: After solving for "q", we can plug that value into the first equation to get  n is equal to 3 times 19 minus, 6  which we can determine  n  to be  51 .
